result.execSummary:
The defendant Delvin T Manavong was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $67 VW surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted.

IN CUSTODY 11:21 AM Defendant Delvin T Manavong in court, in custody.  Attorney Will Rice Anderson in court for Delvin T Manavong.  Prosecuting attorney Cecilia E DeMarco in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT 1
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve  30 days in Dane County Jail, with Huber; 

-Days credit for time served:  30 days
-Days credit to jail: 30 days
-Deemed Served

Ct 1
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days.

-DNA on file


-Defendant advised of post-conviction rights
